column25: Own a piece of Concord’s history with SCENIC LAND and RIVERBANKS seemingly untouched since the days when Thoreau described them in his journals. This 24 ACRE FARM runs along the banks of the Sudbury River with 850 FT OF RIVERFRONT and a BOAT LAUNCH surrounded by hundreds of protected acres stretching to Walden Pond. GRAND, HISTORIC, and ROMANTIC, the property preserves what is most authentic in SHINGLE-STYLE ARCHITECTURE in a pristine,19th century landscape. The combination of proximity to river frontage and conservation land, with easy access to Route 2 and the commuter rail in Concord center, makes this property a UNIQUE and HIGHLY DESIRABLE offering.

column25: PLEASE USE GPS 1590 PINE STREET.  THIS IS THE MODEL HOME.  "The Fairfield".  Lot 41.  It is "stunning" and offers all "bells and whistles"!  You must see for yourself what Dighton has to offer.  Welcome to “Stoney Ridge Estates”, Dighton’s premier subdivision minutes to all highway routes to Providence & Boston (Route 24, 44 & I-195). Located under six miles from Exit 11 (Padelford St.) off Route 24, you will appreciate the ease of commuting to & from the place you call “home”.  The neighborhood offers luxurious home sites that are enveloped with glorious woodlands. You will admire the awesome curb appeal as you enter the neighborhood decorated with plentiful flowering shrubs & perennials, a recreational park to enjoy on a warm, sunny day, & sidewalks to stroll! This neighborhood is a “one-of-kind” & offers six model floor designs ranging from 1,762 to 2,384 square feet.  Pricing varies depending on size & model floor design selection.

column25: A very unique property. Original center chimney, 2 bed room, colonial style home with wide board flooring and wonderful view from the early 80's. This gave way to another larger single family home at which time the first house became office, warehouse, storage space for a home based business. Current newer single family is energy efficient beautifully laid out with open floor plan. Large kitchen with Island and dining area off. There is a wonderful living room with large deck that looks east over the Hampshire Hills 3-4  upstairs bed rooms with full bath and laundry. Vaulted ceilings and great view. The basement is partially finished with tile floor and pool table. One 4.4 acre lot, great views, quiet location, Both structures need some work having been rented and neglected for a short term but are now in good shape and ready for the finishing touches. Rare opportunity where you really get 2 for LESS than the price of one. Come see for yourself

column25: MARBLEHEAD NECK WITH SEPARATE CARRIAGE HOUSE: Situated on over an acre of private grounds, this stately 1910 English country style home with 5 bedrooms and 3.5 baths combines the detail and charm of day's past with many recent upgrades. column25: Now offered FOR-SALE.  Rich with HISTORY, and once the Sacred Heart Church of Groton, built in 1884, as the Chapel for the Groton School on Farmers Row.  The Church was given to the Groton Catholics and moved to Main Street in 1904.  Dedicated as a Catholic Church in 1905, and used for the next 102 years.   Under the Zoning By Laws, the property can be used for Religious Purposes, Residential, Educational Purposes, a Day Care, and many others.  New HVAC, Electrical Upgrades.  Located in the heart of Groton center, it is within walking distance to restaurants, a supermarket, the Town Library, public elementary and middle schools and the Nashua River Rail Trail.  Town Water and Sewer.  Parking for 40 to 50 cars.  Note: Bedroom and Bathroom counts are for search purposes only.

column25: Cuttyhunk Island, part of the Elizabeth Islands off the southern coast of Massachusetts is located between Buzzards Bay and Vineyard Sound. Just 550± acres with a year-round population of approximately 30 residents, the quaint island offers a quiet, beautiful, ocean environment perfect for fishing, sailing, reading and relaxing. The island’s population swells as summer residents, vacationers and boaters head over when the weather warms. Pleasantries on the island include brunches at the Fishing Club, seasonal food shacks by the pier, and small yacht club that primarily provides activities for children. The offering includes a stately custom main residence (Winter House), a one-story seasonal residence (Annex), a two-story seasonal residence (Rose Cottage), a large barn, and two accessory structures on 7.90± acres (surveyed) with impressive panoramic water views to the north, east, and south. A 2.63± acre Conservation Restriction runs along the western boundary of the property.

column25: IN-LAW ALERT! Introducing a beautiful New England Colonial w/ legal in-law, situated in one of Bridgewater's most sought after neighborhoods!  This one owner home features 4 total bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, beautiful mature landscaping, two car garage, enormous deck, and much much more.  The main living level has freshly sanded hardwood floors in the entry and dining room.  The kitchen overlooks the beautifully landscaped backyard and is open to the family room. The in-law also features it's own private entrance via the sliding glass door to the back deck and yard.  There are three generously sized bedrooms on the 2nd floor of the main home, and an oversize bathroom.  The master bedroom sports an awesome walk-in closet.  The walkout basement has an entertainment room, office, and laundry area.  All of this on a 1/2 acre lot in a great family neighborhood!  This is a must see!

Nestled in a prime commuting location, 224 Lincoln St. offers convenience and potential rarely seen in one of the most desirable communities in all of Massachusetts. Most recently used and legally zoned as a multi-family residence, this elegant Victorian is ready for your personal touch and vision. Possible options include converting to a large one family residence, a condo conversion, or simply using the in-law apartment to offset mortgage. 12 rooms, 4 bedrooms, and 2.5 baths. Approximately 3,284 sq feet of living area offers great expansion and update options! The house sits within walking distance of the Eliot MBTA station on the green line, just a few stops down from Fenway and the rest of downtown Boston. Proximity to Routes 9 and 95, minutes to the Chestnut Hill shopping area, and the many perks that the town of Newton has to offer are additional bonuses. With a few updates, this house could increase in value dramatically.

column25: If these walls could talk imagine all the amazing stories they would tell of the founding fathers, Cunningham, Collicott, Glover, and Pierce as they held robust discussions and devised plans for what is now the highly desirable Town of Milton.  Nestled on a private half acre stands this Circa 1733 historical home referred to as the “Meeting House”. Steeped in character & charm, period design elements such as Dutch doors, picture windows, high ceilings, crown molding, built-in book cases, cupboards, hardwood floors and many fireplace(s) abound. The best history has to offer combined with newer systems, skylights, & roof. South facing, many rooms exude natural warmth complimented by a bright & rich color palette. Only the lucky few who place value on history, privacy, and one-of-a kind living, with a strong emphasis for nature lovers, hikers and those with a green thumb will find their dreams fulfilled @1072. Award Winning Schools, Milton Academy, Hospital, Marketplace & Commuter Rail.

Walk out finished basement boasts a family room, office, laundry room, and a dedicated storage / mechanical area. This property features an open concept feel, excellent sized rooms, built in cabinets, hardwoods, 2 fireplaces (1 pellet stove), new carpeting in the basement, deck, 2 car attached garage, and a newer Buderus furnace. All appliances remain for the new owner’s enjoyment. The seasonal views from the backyard/deck are a real treat. Convenient location - just  minutes from downtown, major routes, bike path, shopping, Atkins & area colleges. Start the new year in this delightful home! Open House - December 2 from 11-12:30.

A Finished walk-out lower level with Family Room, Bathroom/Laundry Room, utility room plus a Play Room.  Additional Amenities include Central Air, Young roof & heating system, 1 Car Garage, Town Water & Sewer plus the Potential Expansion in the Walk-Up Attic. Millis’ Award winning school system & great commuter location

Perfect home for live-work or just live fabulously!

column25: Durkee Farm Estates  is a new neighborhood of 28 quality crafted, energy efficient, open concept homes that combine traditional NE style architecture with updated designs and features.  This new community is a thoughtful reuse of the Durkee Tree Farm which blends large areas of open space and scenic vistas to create exceptional new home sites.  You’ll love the small town NE feel of Durkee Farm Estates and with Littleton’s location at the intersections of Routes 2 and 495, you’ll be just a 45 minute drive to Boston or you can avoid the traffic and walk across the street to the MBTA commuter rail and arrive in Boston  in just an hour!   You’ll also love the shopping, dining, and recreation options at the newly built development, The Point, which features lots of favorite retailers and restaurants. This new community is being developed by two of the areas most respected local builders with decades of experience. Call us today and see how you can make Durkee Farm Estates your new home!

Bonus feature:  a large two-story barn in the back.  Located in the Columbines Neighborhood, 99 Maple is on a quiet street, less than .5 mile from 2 stops on the Red Line Trolley. Milton offers something for everyone: top rated public-schools with competitive sports teams and an outstanding performing arts program, a superior community hospital, a modern public library, a community arts center, the Neponset bike path & much more

column24: Call List Agent, Lock Box, Appointment Required, Sign
column25: Own a piece of history.  This Antique home c.1770 was one of the original school houses in Leverett.  It still retains some of the original features including the old wide-board floors, exposed beams, hardware and a lot of cozy charm.  John Keets bought the house in 1776 and members of his family resided there for several decades.  Just a quick 5 minutes to Amherst and the University, you have ample room for outdoor activities and gardening.  The wood stove heats most of the house, and feels great on those snowy winter days.  For summer there is a large screened porch on the south side of the house.  Additional storage space is available in the basement. Broadband connection is in place.

column25: Open House canceled Sunday 2/11. Wonderful 4 bedroom 3 1/2 bath home in desirable Weston neighborhood sited on a naturally landscaped approx 3/4 acre wooded lot. Great open floorplan on three levels perfect for entertaining and relaxation. Expansive windows throughout offer scenic views and lots of natural light. Nicely updated kitchen with custom cabinets, stainless steel appliances and granite countertops opens to dining area, spacious living and family rooms both with fireplaces. There is a private second floor master suite and three additional bedrooms on the main level - one en suite with double vanity and marble flooring. The lower level has a large playroom w/ fireplace, bonus/exercise room, half bath/laundry room and office or guest bedroom w private separate entrance. Lovingly mantained with gleaming hardwood floors, newer roof, deck and many updates. The commuter rail to Boston North Station is right around the corner. A great opportunity to live in Weston.

column25: DISCOVER PLYMPTON! Situated on a level 1.82 acre lot is this three level 2400+ SF 5 Bedroom Colonial with 2.5 baths! The open first level is quite equipped for entertaining both family and friends. The Kitchen has stainless appliances, granite top counters and tile flooring in both the Kitchen and Dining areas. A brick fireplace is the focal point of the large Living Room that flows into the DA & Kitchen area. In addition, there is a 1st floor Bedroom and a full bath. 2nd level has 4 more Bedrooms with two connected to a large half bath. A full bath supports all bedrooms/ A fully carpeted third level offers an exercise area, Family room or library? The "barn" is a workshop as well and has water plus an electric service. The full basement comes with double oil tanks, a 200 amp elec service, a separate hot water heater and plenty of built in shelving. Enjoy late afternoons on the farmers porch. Two cantilevered 2nd level decks. Horses and farming on this little piece of Plympton "heaven.

Three secondary bedrooms, each with a walk-in-closet, a hall bath with double vanity and separate toilet/tub area, and laundry round out the second floor. A perfect location for commuting, a large back yard and a good, friendly neighborhood on the Bolton/Lancaster line make this home ideal.

column25: VICTORIAN DIAMOND IN THE ROUGH! This home needs excessive work, but, it can be something really special with some vision and hard work! This once beautiful antique home takes you back to the days of grandeur. Walking into huge rooms with high ceilings, gorgeous hardwood floors, french doors, pocket doors, and walls of windows. The modest kitchen has a half bath with laundry and a swinging door to the once breathtaking dining room, complete with large bay window and built in hutch. French doors lead you from one room to the other on the main level.  The decorative lead glass windows and doors along with the substantial crown moldings throughout are just unparalleled. There are 3 generous bedrooms on the second level and 2 additional rooms on the third level. There is a full basement that was partially finished at one time. Outside you have a porch, patio and 2 car garage. Partially fenced in back yard has plenty of room for anything you desire. A true diamond in the rough!

Set back on a level lot with mature plantings, the property boasts architectural shingles/roof, 4 bedrooms, 2.5 baths, indoor grill/kitchen, with dramatic cathedral ceilings, and soaring two level brick fireplace. This wonderful property is ready for your personal touches as you make it your own.

column25: Beautifully maintained Contemporary Cape home on a handsome corner lot.  This home was custom built for original owner with quality craftsmanship.  Minutes to nearby Menauhant Beach, Kenyon's Plaza and only approx .25 mile to neighborhood boat ramp for easy access to ocean.  This home is in move-in condition with hardwood flooring throughout. Features include a living room/family room with vaulted ceiling, dining room with slider to private patio. First floor master with full bath and three spacious bedrooms on the second floor. Eat-in kitchen with ceramic tile floor and slider to patio. First floor laundry.  The one car garage has great storage capacity. 2015 Roof.  2017 irrigation system.  Falmouth is known for its beautiful beaches and its charming seaside town.  The Falmouth Village Green, The Nobska Lighthouse, and the Annual Falmouth Road Race make this town special. It has an array of fabulous restaurants and shopping and is just a 30 minute ferry ride to Martha's Vineyard.

And if you feel like taking walk, stroll down to the public beach at Fresh Pond. Plenty to enjoy here!!!!

column25: In  the heart of Myopia Hill, this "Arts and Crafts" home is looking forward to its new owner!  Built in 1912 by the Barton Family, there have been only three owners who have enjoyed this beautifully constructed house.  With high ceilings, wood floors, original woodwork, casement windows and a traditional floor plan,  the finishes are of exceptional quality. On the lower level is an artist's studio which is also perfect for a home office.  For getting into Boston or Cambridge easily, downtown Winchester has two stops on the Boston-Lowell commuter rail plus there is a bus to Alewife on Cambridge Street.  The wooded lot provides lots of beautiful perennials when Spring arrives.  Don't miss out on this well preserved home and see if you can locate the "Bolection Molding."
